By Gracie Daw

Forget the Grammys and the BRITs - the real verdict is in.

On The Radar: Will Butler, Liam Bailey, Punch Brothers, Real Lies & Circa Waves

Tom Armston-Clarke talks to front man Van McCann to find out if the band's ambition knows any limits.

Becky Hill: The Voice of determination

The upcoming star talks to Victoria Chater-Lea about talent shows, touring, and accumulating industry contacts

Enter Shikari: "No label wanted to release our music."

Lead guitarist Rory Clewlow explains to Ricky Jones why the band refuse to tone down their notoriously intense sound

Beki Elmer catches up with the Yorkshire-based band following the release of their debut album

Alex Donaldson's recommendations for the best local and student bands in York

Playing Cowboy Chords

The folk singer speaks to Hatti Linnell about preserving live music venues, coping with media negativity and how life is sometimes like the Wizard of Oz.

Bourne in York

Cellist and singer-songwriter India Bourne tells Alfie Packham about her life at UoY, life with Ben Howard, and life on stage

By James Bithell

By James Bithell

By James Bithell

Ahead of Meadowlark's first headline tour, Kate McGill speaks to Hatti Linnell about the band's first year together and their love of festivals.

By James Bithell

Dom Ganderton of Superfood chats to Hatti Linnell about getting a band together, touring and the stresses that come with making an album.
